title: Snapshot: override_status_bar not working
body:
### New Issue Checklist - [x] Updated fastlane to the latest version - [x] I read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] I read [docs.fastlane.tools](https://docs.fastlane.tools) - [x] I searched for [existing GitHub issues](https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues) ### Issue Description I'm using the command `override_status_bar(true)` in my Snapfile but it doesn't work at all. The simulator is just showing the normal status bar instead of overriding the values. I think the issue is that the command to modify the statusbar is executed too early. If I just run it in my terminal I'm getting this error: 
$ xcrun simctl status_bar 96038F3E-9905-4BE1-8386-B55B760AA111 override --time 2007-01-09T09:41:00-07:00 --dataNetwork wifi --wifiMode active --wifiBars 3 --cellularMode active --cellularBars 4 --batteryState charged --batteryLevel 100
An error was encountered processing the command (domain=com.apple.CoreSimulator.SimError, code=405):
Unable to lookup in current state: Shutdown
This error is just sent to /dev/null when Fastlane runs and therefore hidden (even if --verbose is used). During the run, I see that the Simulator app starts but no actual simulators are running yet when the `xcrun simctl status_bar` is executed. They would still have the *Shutdown* state. Fastlane should first complete the build and modify the status bar after `Test Suite FastlaneScreenshots.xctest started` when the simulator has started completely. ##### Command executed bundle exec fastlane snapshot ##### Complete output when running fastlane, including the stack trace and command used 
$ î‚° bundle exec fastlane snapshot
[âœ”] ðŸš€

```ruby
platform :ios do
  desc "Generate new localized screenshots"
  lane :screenshots do
    capture_screenshots(workspace: "Product.xcworkspace", scheme: "FastlaneScreenshots")
  end
end

```
